business.headline: Are gold and silver heading towards record highs this week?Gold and silver prices in India have climbed sharply as the rupee lost ground against the US dollar, with market observers attributing these patterns to global economic indicators and currency stress.
Will the EPS-95 minimum pension be raised from Rs 1,000 to Rs 7,500?As pensioner groups renew their demand for a hike, is the government finally considering raising the EPS-95 minimum pension?

If it was forged, why not tell us?: Man refutes insurer's fraud tag on sister's claimA dangerous blood clot put Purvi Gupta in the hospital, and her family expected their insurer to stand by them. What they say they faced instead was months of paperwork, confusion and a fraud tag they insist they were never told about. This week's 'Claim Denied' story follows a family left stunned by the outcome.

Currency crisis explained: Why is Rupee falling constantlyA weaker rupee makes imports more expensive, increases inflation risks and raises costs for companies dependent on foreign goods, especially fuel and machinery.

December 15 ITR deadline: Do you need to pay the 3rd advance tax instalment?The deadline for the third advance tax instalment for FY26 is approaching. Here's what taxpayers need to know about who must pay, what counts as advance tax liability, and the consequences of missing this important date.

Meesho IPO retail portion fully subscribed. Check latest GMP, total subscriptionA fully subscribed retail book and a steady Rs 49 GMP have set strong early cues for Meesho's IPO, with eyes now on whether institutional demand will push valuations higher.

Rupee in freefall, slides past 90 against US dollar: What next?The key question now is whether the rupee stabilises or slides deeper. All eyes are on the RBI's policy signal, foreign flows, and any movement in the India–US trade talks.

Meesho IPO open for bidding: Should you subscribe? Check strength and key risksMeesho IPO is a book-built issue worth Rs 5,421.20 crore. This includes a fresh issue of 38.29 crore shares worth Rs 4,250 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 10.55 crore shares worth Rs 1,171.20 crore.

Rupee hits all-time low, slips past 90 against US dollar for first timeThe rupee's slide to 90 heightens cost pressures for households and businesses, fuels import-driven inflation risks and leaves markets looking to the RBI for stronger support.
Sensex, Nifty open flat as rupee hits all-time lowThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 281.56 points to 84,856.71, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 105.10 points to 25,927.10 as of 9:40 am.

Delhi startup founder shuts down company after 'frivolous complaint' by clientAccording to its LinkedIn profile, Wherehouse was founded in 2021 as a supply chain intelligence company, helping brands move closer to their customers, enabling faster and more efficient deliveries, and driving business growth.

RBI MPC meet begins today: Will rate cuts finally return?In its October meeting, the MPC kept the repo rate steady at 5.5% for a fourth straight time. RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra had then said that inflation had moderated sharply, giving the committee confidence to maintain its stance.

EU to push ahead with plan to use Russia's frozen assets for Ukraine: ReportEU leaders agreed in October to meet Ukraine's "pressing financial needs" for the next two years but stopped short of endorsing a plan to use 140 billion euros ($162 billion) in frozen Russian sovereign assets in Europe as a loan for Kyiv, due to concerns raised by Belgium.

From ICICI and HDFC to SBI: Here's what 5 major banks are charging on personal loansBefore applying for a personal loan, it's worth knowing how much the leading banks are charging at the moment. Whether you prefer a private lender or a public-sector bank, understanding the latest interest rates can guide you towards a smarter borrowing decision.

Rent, cars, credit: CA explains why old financial wisdom no longer worksThe financial world young earners face today looks nothing like what their parents experienced. From renting to car ownership, an expert says that traditional advice no longer fits today's numbers, and sticking to it may do more harm than good.
Sensex closes 500 points lower, Nifty below 26,100; RIL down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 503.63 points to close at 85,138.27, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 143.55 points to end at 26,032.20.

Aequs IPO to open for bidding soon: Subscribe or skip the Rs 900 crore issue?Aequs IPO is sized at Rs 921.81 crore. This includes a fresh issue of 5.40 crore shares worth Rs 670 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 2.03 crore shares worth Rs 251.81 crore.

Planning to rent in 2025? Here's what changes with the new renting rulesOne of the biggest changes in the New Rent Rules 2025 is that all rental agreements must now be digitally stamped and registered online within 60 days

Rs 10,000 SIP vs Rs 1.2 lakh lump sum: Which creates more wealth?Is a Rs 10,000 monthly SIP smarter for long-term wealth, or does investing Rs 1.2 lakh at once create a bigger corpus? As markets turn unpredictable, this question is becoming more important for everyday investors.

Gold softens, silver drops: Why are they losing momentum after Monday's rally?Gold and silver paused their strong rally from Monday, opening lower on Tuesday amid profit booking and weaker global sentiment. The dip raises a key question: why have the metals lost momentum so quickly?

entertainment.headline: Indian Idol 12 winner Pawandeep Rajan recalls fatal accident: No one was helping us Indian Idol 12 winner Pawandeep Rajan discussed the serious road accident he experienced in May 2025, sharing details of the incident and his recovery process, including multiple surgeries for significant injuries.

Ahmed was scared to choreograph for Rangeela: Ramu told me 'You are nobody' Ahmed Khan recalled choreographing 'Rangeela' at just 19 years old in an exclusive interview. The film, starring Urmila Matondkar, Aamir Khan and Jackie Shroff, was re-released in theatres on November 28.

Director Mohan G seeks Chinmayi's clarification on apology over Draupadi 2 song row Director Mohan G has publicly called on singer Chinmayi Sripada to clarify her apology over her involvement in his film Draupadi 2, following social media backlash regarding her participation.

Pankaj Tripathi on daughter Aashi's acting debut: New generation is very sharp Actor Pankaj Tripathi reflected on watching his daughter Aashi perform in her first play. He also responded to a question about her possible future in acting.

Tara Sutaria opens up on privacy after confirming romance with Veer Pahariya Tara Sutaria recently said she is very protective of her personal life and shares what she's comfortable with. The admission came after she grabbed attention with her romantic photos and public appearances with 'Sky Force' actor Veer Pahariya.

Typhoon Family review: Jun-ho, Min-ha's chemistry rewards your patienceRelease Date:Sat Oct 11, 2025 Typhoon Family is a K-drama set against South Korea's 1997 financial crisis showcasing Lee Jun-ho and Kim Min-ha's chemistry. The series explores family, finance and love while rewarding viewers' patience with strong performances.

Janhvi Kapoor slams media's voyeuristic culture, recalls pain of Sridevi's death Janhvi Kapoor addressed the issue of media sensationalism and the impact of social media on human morality, drawing on her personal experiences following her mother Sridevi's death and recent false reports about actor Dharmendra.

Tere Ishk Mein box office Day 5: Dhanush-Kriti film surges. See collection Aanand L Rai's romantic-drama 'Tere Ishk Mein', featuring Dhanush and Kriti Sanon, recorded a 25% box office hike on Tuesday. It rebounded after Monday's steep 54% drop and surpassed notable earnings benchmarks.

Bride Samantha's glow is unmatched in new pics from wedding with Raj Nidimoru Actor Samantha Ruth Prabhu married filmmaker Raj Nidimoru in a close-knit ceremony at Coimbatore's Isha Yoga Centre. Their wedding, featuring traditional rituals and minimalistic elegance, has been the talk of the town for the past two days.

Aamir Khan, Vir Das reunite after 14 years for Happy Patel. Watch announcement video Aamir Khan Productions has announced the upcoming spy film Happy Patel: Khatarnak Jasoos, directed by Vir Das and starring the comedian with Mona Singh. The project, set for release on January 16, 2026, was revealed through a humorous announcement video featuring Aamir Khan and Vir Das, highlighting the film's unconventional approach.

The Great Shamsuddin Family: Farida Jalal heads ensemble cast of JioHotstar drama The Great Shamsuddin Family, a new film by Anusha Rizvi, will premiere on JioHotstar in December, marking her first directorial venture since Peepli Live. The ensemble cast includes Farida Jalal, Sheeba Chadha, Kritika Kamra and Purab Kohli, among others.

Palaash Muchhal visits Premanand Maharaj amid row over cheating allegation Palaash Muchhal was recently seen attending a satsang in Vrindavan after his wedding with cricketer Smriti Mandhana was put on hold. The internet has reacted to his visit.

Vikrant Massey on wife Sheetal's 30-hour labour: No man can match what women endure Vikrant Massey shares insights on how parenthood has transformed him, emphasising his admiration for his wife, Sheetal Thakur, after witnessing her strength during a 30-hour labour.

Mohanlal to reunite with Rajinikanth for Jailer 2 after Drishyam 3 wrap Actor Mohanlal boarded the set of Jailer 2 shortly after finishing Drishyam 3, reuniting with Rajinikanth, Ramya Krishnan, and other returning cast members as production began under director Nelson Dilipkumar.

Dhurandhar: Censors ask to cut, replace violent scenes, mute cuss words The Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC) has officially cleared Aditya Dhar's Dhurandhar, starring Ranveer Singh The film has been granted an A certificate, with further details regarding its runtime and storyline now public.

The Vampire Diaries' Kat Graham announces pregnancy with husband Bryant Wood Kat Graham, known for Vampire Diaries, has announced her first pregnancy with husband Bryant Wood through elegant Instagram photos. The couple recently celebrated their second wedding ceremony.

BB 19: Shehbaz on Amaal's bromance, why he won't meet Ashnoor or Abhishek again In an exclusive interview with India Today, Shehbaz Badesha spoke about his eviction from Bigg Boss 19 before the finale. He expressed his gratitude over the love received from fans and also got candid about his friendship with Amaal Malik.

Forbidden Fruits teaser: Lili Reinhart, Lola Tung front witch-cult thriller Forbidden Fruits, directed by Meredith Alloway, introduces a star-studded cast in a horror film centred around a hidden witch cult within a mall store. It stars Lili Reinhart, Lola Tung and Victoria Pedretti.

Bollywood in a spot: Gone are the days, or can Hindi cinema bounce back? Bollywood seems to be in crisis. Mumbai Cinema is at the crossroads of big-budget flops, star power and southern challenge. What is the way for the Hindi film industry to recover?

general news.headline: Flights hit across India as glitch impacts check-ins, chaos at Hyderabad airportA glitch in airport check-in systems caused widespread disruptions across India, leading to chaotic scenes at Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Airport.

Congress posts AI video of PM selling tea at red-carpet event, triggers rowThe BJP was quick to condemn the AI-generated video, accusing the Congress of "abusing" Prime Minister Narendra Modi yet again.

Delhi MCD bypolls: BJP dominates but loses 2 wards held previouslyThe MCD bypolls served as a key litmus test for the BJP, marking its first electoral challenge since the party stormed to power in the national capital after the Assembly elections in February.

If it was forged, why not tell us?: Man refutes insurer's fraud tag on sister's claimWhen a dangerous blood clot hospitalised Purvi Gupta, her family expected their insurer to stand by them. Instead, they recount months of bewildering paperwork, escalating confusion, and a sudden fraud tag they insist was never disclosed. This week's 'Claim Denied' story follows a family left stunned and fighting for answers.

Raj Nidimoru's sister welcomes Samantha: We stand by them without hesitationActor Samantha Ruth Prabhu and filmmaker Raj Nidimoru's wedding on December 1 in Coimbatore was followed by a warm family welcome, with Raj's sister sharing a heartfelt message and the first family portrait.

2nd ODI Live: Rohit Sharma falls after boundary barageIndia vs South Africa 2nd ODI Live Score and Updates: South Africa have finally found their breakthrough, and it is the big one of Rohit Sharma, who had only hit a 3-in-a-row boundary to gain some attacking touch. Virat Kohli comes in at number 3 for India.

Radical Islamist Asim Munir yearns for war with India, says Imran Khan's sisterIn an all-out attack on Pakistani army chief Asim Munir, Imran Khan's sister called him a radical Islamist and an Islamic conservative who yearned for a full-scale war with India.

What is S-500 missile system India is eyeing after Op Sindoor successPutin India visit: The S-400 missile system brought Pakistan to its knees during India's Operation Sindoor. Now, with Russian President Putin to arrive in India on Thursday, India is eyeing its stronger and smarter brother - the S-500 air shield.

Assam doctor steps in after family claims woman is 'acting' despite critical stateThrough his post on X, Dr Priyam Bordoloi attempted to explain how family dismissal and medical negligence within households can endanger lives.

Live: Amit Shah, Nadda, BL Santosh meet in Parliament over BJP president electionParliament Winter Session Live: Lok Sabha on Wednesday took up the Question Hour without disruptions for the first time in the ongoing Winter session, a day after the logjam over the opposition's demand for a discussion on SIR was resolved. Rajya Sabha is likely to initiate a privilege motion against Renuka Chaudhary over her recent remarks involving "dogs and barking," which the House views as a potential breach of parliamentary dignity and security norms. The Upper House is currently examining the matter, even as political strategy intensifies ahead of the next sitting. Leaders of the INDIA bloc are scheduled to meet tomorrow at 9.45 am in Parliament to plan their coordinated strategy on the floor of the House. Meanwhile, an all-party meeting has reached a consensus to hold a full-day debate on Vande Mataram on Tuesday, followed by discussions on poll reforms on December 9. Stay tuned with India Today for live updates.

The soldier village of India: Where nearly every home has a 'jawan'Gahmar, India's largest village of soldiers, continues to inspire generations with its deep-rooted military heritage. Despite modern challenges, the community's commitment to defence service remains unwavering and a source of collective pride.
Watch: China's private rocket explodes while attempting to landLaunched on December 3, 2025, the 66-meter methane-fueled vehicle marked China's boldest reusable rocket attempt yet.
Why the thrill of a sale leaves some people anxious, guilty and in therapyIndian psychologists admit that overspending and excessive shopping are common concerns among their clients.

The picture that became defining symbol of deadly Hong Kong blazeA viral photo of a grieving husband has become the defining image of the Hong Kong blaze that killed more than 150 people. His anguish, captured amid the devastation, now symbolizes the city's deadliest fire in decades.

Bride Samantha's glow is unmatched in new pics from wedding with Raj NidimoruActor Samantha Ruth Prabhu married filmmaker Raj Nidimoru in a close-knit ceremony at Coimbatore's Isha Yoga Centre. Their wedding, featuring traditional rituals and minimalistic elegance, has been the talk of the town for the past two days.

Watch: KL Rahul left frustrated as India lose 20th straight ODI toss in RaipurIndia captain KL Rahul was left gutted as the Indian team lost their 20th straight toss in ODIs with South Africa getting the luck of the coin in Raipur.

Congress's Renuka Chowdhury asked about dog in Parliament row. Her bizarre replyRenuka Chowdhury, who sparked a row by bringing a dog to Parliament, brushed off questions about a possible privilege motion with a quirky "Bhau Bhau" before walking away.

The country that actually lost a war to birds: The true story of the Emu WarAustralia once launched a military operation against emus destroying farmlands, with soldiers armed with machines guns. But the birds outsmarted the soldiers, leading to Australia's embarrassing loss in the famously absurd Emu War of 1932.

Bollywood in a spot: Gone are the days, or can Hindi cinema bounce back?Bollywood seems to be in crisis. Mumbai Cinema is at the crossroads of big-budget flops, star power and southern challenge. What is the way for the Hindi film industry to recover?

Can Jamaat-e-Islami spring a surprise by beating BNP in Bangladesh?The Khaleda Zia-led BNP was considered an unchallenged frontrunner in the Bangladesh general election promised in February 2026 by chief advisor Muhammad Yunus. A new poll shows the Jamaat-e-Islami breathing down the BNP's neck with a difference of just four percentage points. This is why the Jamaat gained and why India needs to be prepared for any eventuality.

Loan grows bigger, cash shrinks: How falling rupee cripples Indian students abroadOther than trade and exports, a falling rupee has a bearing on the tens of thousands of Indians studying abroad. While education loans balloon as fees go up in rupee terms, families based in India need to spend more on the dollars needed for students based in the US, Canada and the UK.

Trump slams allies for rip-offs, says he won't use names, then blurts out twoTrump criticised American allies Japan and South Korea for 'ripping off' the US amid global tariff discussions, highlighting long-standing trade disputes in a candid meeting.

Ahmed was scared to choreograph for Rangeela: Ramu told me 'You are nobody'Ahmed Khan recalled choreographing 'Rangeela' at just 19 years old in an exclusive interview. The film, starring Urmila Matondkar, Aamir Khan and Jackie Shroff, was re-released in theatres on November 28.

sports.headline: Watch: KL Rahul left frustrated as India lose 20th straight ODI toss in Raipur India captain KL Rahul was left gutted as the Indian team lost their 20th straight toss in ODIs with South Africa getting the luck of the coin in Raipur.

Harshit Rana reprimanded for aggressive send-off to Dewald Brevis in Ranchi Harshit Rana has been reprimanded for breaching Level 1 of the ICC Code of Conduct during the first ODI against South Africa in Ranchi on Sunday. Rana admitted to the offence, which involved a gesture after dismissing Dewald Brevis in the 22nd over of South Africa's innings.

How an IPL- styled league is bringing about a revolution in Pickleball in India? Pickleball as a sport is capturing the imagination of many people in India, and to capitalise on that, a new Indian Pickleball League was inaugurated in New Delhi and one hopes that the league taps into the exponential growth of Pickleball in India.

Shubman Gill's injury rehab timeline: Batter set for final test on December 5 India opener Shubman Gill is on track with his neck injury recovery ahead of the South Africa T20I series. His final fitness clearance hinges on a Return to Play match scheduled for December 5.

Kohli won't come back to Tests now: Kaif rules out retirement U-turn for star Former cricketer Mohammed Kaif feels that Virat Kohli will never make a retirement U-turn in Test cricket. There were rumours that BCCI were thinking about bringing back Kohli into the long format after recent results.

How Boland bounced back from a horrific 1st innings in Perth? Pacer reveals Scott Boland bounced back from a tough first innings in the first Ashes Test against England. He went on to pick a four-wicket haul in the second innings, playing a key role in Australia's win.

SA came to India with purpose and belief, not just to compete: Tabraiz Shamsi Tabraiz Shamsi feels South Africa's strong preparation and collective belief proved crucial in whitewashing India 2-0. He credited the team for overcoming previous challenges and scripting history.

2nd ODI Live: Rohit Sharma falls after boundary barage India vs South Africa 2nd ODI Live Score and Updates: South Africa have hurt themselves more than Yashasvi Jaiswal's attacking batting, having leaked majority of the runs through extras. But, Jaiswal looks like he wants to make full use of his chance.

Watch: Virat Kohli unleashes six barrage in Raipur to thrill fans ahead of 2nd ODI Virat Kohli went on a six-hitting rampage to thrill the fans in Raipur on the eve of the second ODI between India and South Africa. Kohli and the Indian team put in the final touches as they aim to seal the series with a win on Wednesday, December 3.

Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli in World Cup 2027? Hope they don't make it, jokes Gurbaz Afghanistan wicketkeeper Rahmanullah Gurbaz said that no one can say that Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli shouldn't be in the squad for the ODI World Cup 2027. Gurbaz, however, joked that he won't mind having to face the duo during the ICC event.

How Boland bounced back from a horrific 1st innings in Perth? Pacer reveals Scott Boland bounced back from a tough first innings in the first Ashes Test against England. He went on to pick a four-wicket haul in the second innings, playing a key role in Australia's win.

Kohli and the Indian team put in the final touches as they aim to seal the series with a win on Wednesday, December 3.

Hope they don't make it, jokes Gurbaz Afghanistan wicketkeeper Rahmanullah Gurbaz said that no one can say that Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli shouldn't be in the squad for the ODI World Cup 2027. Gurbaz, however, joked that he won't mind having to face the duo during the ICC event.

Serena Williams denies tennis return despite re-entering anti-doping test poolSerena Williams put to rest mounting speculation about her tennis future after confirming she has no plans to return, even as her re-entry into the International Tennis Integrity Agency anti-doping pool stoked widespread comeback rumors.

Haaland creates history as Manchester City down Fulham in goal festManchester City extended their winning streak over Fulham with a 5–4 victory, as Erling Haaland became the fastest player to reach 100 Premier League goals. Newcastle and Tottenham played out a 2–2 draw, with Cristian Romero scoring twice for Spurs, including a stoppage-time equaliser.

India's next in line: Jaiswal, Ruturaj must prove they belong nowTwo young batters, two crossroads. Jaiswal battles a left-arm pace weakness, Gaikwad seeks validation in his best format. South Africa will reveal whether they're stopgaps—or pillars of India's ODI future.

Rejuvenated Rohit, Virat look to seal series for India in RaipurIND vs SA: India arrive in Raipur having won a tense opening fixture in Ranchi. Rejuvenated by the presence of Rohit and Kohli, the hosts will look to seal the series in the second ODI.

Junior Men's Hockey World Cup: India beat Switzerland 5-0 to reach quarterfinalsManmeet Singh scored twice on his birthday as India sealed a dominant 5-0 win over Switzerland, completing an unbeaten pool stage and securing a place in the quarterfinals of the FIH Men's Junior Hockey World Cup.

Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma still going as hard as 28–30-year-olds, says Madan LalMadan Lal says Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma are playing with the freshness and intensity of 28–30-year-olds, insisting the senior duo should decide their own ODI future as they continue to drive India's performances.

No pressure of paycheque but motivated to do well for UP Warriorz in WPL: DeeptiAfter being bought back by the UP Warriorz for Rs 3.2 crore ahead of the upcoming Women's Premier League, star India all-rounder Deepti Sharma said the price tag brings her no pressure and, if anything, only pushes her to perform better in the fourth edition of the tournament.

Ben Stokes plays down England's dismal Gabba record ahead of pink-ball TestEngland captain Ben Stokes said his side carries no fear of the Gabba despite the venue's daunting Ashes history. Stokes said the current England squad has the confidence and edge to challenge Australia in their own backyard.

Virat Kohli set to play Vijay Hazare Trophy after 15 yearsStar India batter Virat Kohli on Tuesday informed the Delhi and District Cricket Association (DDCA) that he will be available for the upcoming Vijay Hazare Trophy, marking his first appearance in the domestic one-day competition since 2010.

In-form Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma train hard in nets ahead of Ranchi ODIVirat Kohli and Rohit Sharma trained hard during an intense net session, taking on throw-down specialists in tandem ahead of Wednesday's second ODI against South Africa.

2nd ODI Predicted XI: Should India try Tilak in place of Washington Sundar?IND vs SA: Washington Sundar bowled just three overs and had a very poor outing with the bat. Should India invest in Tilak Varma for the middle order position?

Grateful to India: Jayasuriya lauds PM Modi, EAM Jaishankar for swift Sri Lanka aidSanath Jayasuriya has thanked PM Modi, EAM Jaishankar and the people of India as teams lead massive rescue and relief efforts in cyclone-hit Sri Lanka. Operation Sagar Bandhu continues amid catastrophic flooding and landslides.

India to name T20I squad on Wednesday, medical update on Shubman Gill awaitedIndia vs South Africa: The selectors will announce India's T20I squad for the South Africa series on Wednesday (December 3), with the final decision hinging on an expected medical update on Shubman Gill.

Deepender Hooda Blames Haryana Govt Negligence for Death of Two Basketball PlayersIn this special report, Congress MP Deepender Hooda condemns the Haryana government for 'criminal negligence' following the tragic deaths of two young basketball players, Hardik Rathi and Aman, due to collapsing infrastructure. Hooda highlights the decay of sports facilities in the state, revealing, 'I gave 18.5 lakh rupees... for three years the government of Haryana refused to spend that money' on the Lakhan Majra stadium. The Rohtak MP demands ₹1 crore compensation and government jobs for the victims' families, asserting that the state's renowned sports culture is crumbling under the current administration.

AIFF eye flexibility in meeting with Sports Minister on ISL commercial rights tenderWith the ISL tender drawing zero bidders and structural concerns mounting, AIFF arrives for crisis talks, willing to be flexible on commercial terms—provided the government steps in to support national teams and key competitions.

Harshit Rana shrugs off outside noise, credits Kohli-Rohit for guidanceUnder scrutiny for allegedly receiving special backing from head coach Gautam Gambhir, young pacer Harshit Rana said he pays no attention to outside criticism. Rana also credited senior pros Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma for playing a significant role in the good team environment.

Rohit, Kohli make team environment better, push youngsters to improve: Harshit RanaIND vs SA, 2nd ODI: Harshit Rana says the presence of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli brings a positive and motivating environment to the Indian dressing room. Their guidance pushes youngsters to improve and creates a positive culture both on and off the field.

Revanth Reddy vs Lionel Messi: Telangana CM trains hard for Hyderabad face-offTelangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy hit the field at the MCHRD grounds as he continued preparations for his much-anticipated friendly football match against Argentina legend Lionel Messi on December 13.

Sorry state of Gautam Gambhir's Indian Test team reaches Supreme CourtSupreme Court judge MM Sundaresh candidly referred to India's sorry state of affairs in Test cricket. The judge said that India's focus on white-ball cricket had ruined the Test team.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
